main event: A UFO sighting was reported on December 6, 1958, at the Anniston Ordnance Depot in Bynum, Alabama. The object was described as oval-shaped, 30-40 feet in diameter, initially stationary, then rapidly accelerating and disappearing at a high speed.
interesting points: The UFO was observed at a clear moon-lit night, considered reliable by the officer reporting the information.
The object was described as cigar-shaped, 5 to 8 feet in diameter, and approximately 15 feet in height, with unknown color as it was disappearing from visibility.
The report mentioned that the description of the object was contradictory, indicating the difficulty in characterizing the UFO.
No identifiable aircraft or natural phenomena were found to explain the sighting, and no physical evidence or distance measure was available.
The officer conducting the investigation interpreted the object as a reflecting pool or small lake, suggesting an attempt to find a prosaic explanation for the sighting.
witnesses: civilian guards and Mr. McClellan from Anniston Ordnance Depot
